security: Disclosing the use of proprietary companies and guarantees provided to them could compromise ongoing operations and damage the CIA's reputation. Specifically, it is stated that 'This Agency guarantees all agreements entered into (by Collins) and the proprietary.'
summary: William F. Donnelly requests the Office of General Counsel to sign letters of indemnity for Collins Radio, guaranteeing agreements entered into by Collins and an Agency proprietary, Electronic Products International Etablissement, to facilitate research and development work.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated November 17, 1976, from William F. Donnelly, Acting Chief of Division D, requests the Office of General Counsel to sign letters of indemnity to Donald J. Yockey, VP of Collins Government Telecommunications Division, guaranteeing agreements made by Collins Radio and a CIA proprietary company, Electronic Products International Etablissement (Liechtenstein Anstalt). These guarantees are to enable Collins to conduct research and development work on behalf of the Agency. One unclassified and one classified letter are attached, with the classified letter to be acknowledged by Yockey and returned to Agency files, ensuring Collins' cooperation relative to national security.
title: Letter of Indemnity for Collins Radio
sender: William F. Donnelly (Acting Chief, Division D)
